intro: Senecio macdougalii, commonly known as the MacDougal's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and green, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, dandelion-like seed heads that disperse its seeds via the wind. Senecio macdougalii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
